descendants.content: @jackofalltrades they only care about the money

@jackofalltrades

And it was on this day, BigOil finally began caring about climate change (in a very, very small way).

And by "caring" I mean having some desire to stop it or slow it down. They have "cared" very much about it in terms of studying it and how to best downplay and deny it.

account.note:
I'm an environmental economist who researches econ pedagogy to make learning economics marginally less dismal.

My pipe-dream is to write a fantasy novel/economics textbook, which is getting closer to reality every day.

#economics #TeachEcon #sustainability #DoughnutEconomics #degrowth

Profile pic is me smiling in front of a whiteboard with economics gibberish -- cause econ makes me happy.

Background is my dog, Freya, who is derpily sticking her tongue out while passed out.

fields.name: About me
fields.value: Making econ marginally less dismal one post at a time. I teach economics at the UC Denver and am an all around nerd. My goal is to combine my passion for all things fantasy/sci-fi and love of economics to lower the cost of learning econ.

fields.name: Fantastical Economics
fields.value: You can find my first-ever short story that covers the circular economy and sustainability in a sci-fi setting here: https://edgeryders.eu/t/circular-reasoning/19717

descendants.content: @jackofalltrades When a paper concluded that the Corona virus causes impotence, I thought: Oh, well, now people will finally pay attention to the risks and mask up. But, nope, I was proven wrong. I don't think this will make us change our response to climate change. We're a society in total denial of our own demise.

descendants.content:
@jackofalltrades
This is a real catch 22 because the only way to reduce unpredictable short-term weather-related shutdowns is to reduce long-term production.

I doubt it will happen, though, because even if global oil production were eliminated today, it would be centuries before the climate began to recover. No doubt they'll focus on technological solutions to continue production in extreme weather, like submarine rigs in the Gulf and huge fire breaks in the north.
